qas.question: What culture and religion did Fathers of the Church correlate with heresy?
What religion were these Fathers of the Church?
Who suggested that it were the Jews that brought dissension into Christianity?

plausible_answers.text: Christians that refused to venerate religious images

qas.question: Who dit Saint Peter refer to as Jews?
Who did Tertullian say were the most heretical people?
Who offered guidence to early Christians?

context: The Church Fathers identified <a0_0><b3_0>Jews and Judaism<b3_0/><a0_0/> with heresy. They saw deviations from <a1_0>Orthodox Christianity<a1_0/> as heresies that were essentially Jewish in spirit. <a2_0>Tertullian<a2_0/> implied that it was the <b5_0><b6_0>Jews<b6_0/><b5_0/> who most inspired heresy in Christianity: "From the Jew the heretic has accepted guidance in this discussion [that Jesus was not the Christ.]" Saint Peter of Antioch referred to <b4_0>Christians that refused to venerate religious images<b4_0/> as having "Jewish minds".
